channel.title: Mental Health on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Mental Health on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Depression
item.description: Culture and Environment Culture and environment where you eat could be one of the things that could trigger depression. It is also interesting because some of the climate could also be affecting our depression. For example, winter is most likely to trigger depression. One of the reasons is most of the winter people do not get enough exposure to sunlight which is one of the essential sources of vitamin D. Culture also plays a bigger role when talking about depression, this belief because of finding that it happens in Japan.
